question: Dude... I'm scared! Dude! They're all around me! What do I do? WHAT DO I DO?! Mikey's eyes continue to panic. DONATELLO's voice comes in over a RADIO. Calming.
answer: Just relax, Mikey. Remember your training. You'll be fine.

question: But I need back up this time, man! Okay - waita-WHOA-WHOA-WHOA-WHOA!! Suddenly TEN KIDS WITH BIRTHDAY HATS AND FOAM NUNCHUCKS run in SCREAMING and start beating on Mikey... a little too hard. OH-WHOA! OW! YEOW-OW-OW! WATCH IT!! I can only hope they're as lovely as the rugrats you got here. ON KIDS - They look tough, brandishing their nerf weapons - a toddler street gang. One of the kids does a finger-point-then- throat-slit gesture. The mom looks and beams. The kids quickly smile to cover. Such... angels. Mikey looks to the side, and sees the still piled-high stack of PIZZA BOXES through the fake head POV. Hyuk! Cowabunga dudes! Bye! Heheh... score.
answer: Hey, hey, hey... don't forget the face thing.

question: Yes... sir.
answer: That's a good boy.

question: All's I'm saying Donnie is that no one would notice if YOU did one of these gigs every now and again.
answer: But you add such... panache to the character. Mikey, emotional, pops into "fully animated" facial mode. He rubs his sore neck.

question: Well, if panache is French for "punching bag", I'd have to agree with ya.
answer: Close enough. I - uh-oh- ON MONITOR - Don watches Mikey through a TRAFFIC CAM in front of the van. Don is jacked into every major security and surveillance camera in the city. -you got a peeping tom.

question: Aw nuts. Mikey suddenly grips his face back into a tight SMILE, frozen. He looks over and waves at the man who confusingly waves back. Just get me outta here, dude. ON DON - He hits some switches. Monitors change.
answer: Traffic's clear eastbound for two blocks. Then hook up with route J. BACK WITH MIKEY - He's still waving with a frozen smile.

question: Domo arigato, dude. Mikey walks into the room and plops down on a sofa. Hits a remote as a BIG SCREEN lights up in front of him. Suddenly-
answer: MICHAELANGELO! Mikey springs from the couch. Snaps to obedience.

question: Yes, sensei. ANGLE ON - SPLINTER the Japanese rodent master and father of the TMNT. He is well-kempt, still walks with a cane, and has the same sparkle in his eye. He approaches Mikey. Silent.
answer: Well?

question: Sensei? Oh! Here ya go, Master Splinter. Mikey reaches into his bag and removes a foil-wrapped piece of BIRTHDAY CAKE. Splinter lights up.
answer: Ahh! Butter creme frosting! Donatello walks to Splinter. Holds his hand out, judgmental.

question: Ahh! Butter creme frosting! Donatello walks to Splinter. Holds his hand out, judgmental.
answer: Master. No cake. You remember your last cholesterol tests.

question: But I- -Donatello! I am your Master!
answer: Nice try, sensei. But you can still be my Master... with low cholesterol. Splinter surrenders the cake. As Don walks away, Michaelangelo reaches into his bag and secretly passes Splinter a smaller wrapped piece.

question: Careful! That isn't some box full of fish! CAM LOWERS - as APRIL O'NEIL leaps down into frame. Dressed in jungle expedition gear with her head wrapped in a bandana. She takes off her sunglasses and admires the crate. ON BOX - Labelled "O'Neil Cargo". Something ominous about the crate. PUSH IN on it as April steps in front. Admires it with pride. Turns, takes out a cell phone, and hits speed dial. ON PHONE DISPLAY - "Calling HOME". It rings. Where are you? Hey. It's me. I'm back. Casey rubs his face, tries to orient himself. Looks at watch.
answer: Was that today, babe? April's disappointed. Same old Casey.

question: Yes. It was today that I returned to you after being in a deadly jungle for almost a month.
answer: I'm sorry, babe. I must've-

question: Forget it. I'll take a cab. A long pause on the phone. Casey knows he's busted.
answer: I missed you? April doesn't answer. She closes the phone. Casey slumps in his chair, shaking his head. Good goin', Case. Back at the dock, April is back to business.

question: Mmm... home sweet home.
answer: Enter. Leo walks in and kneels in front of Splinter.

question: I have completed my training, master. I am prepared for the next stage.
answer: That you are, my son. You must now apply all that you have learned on your lengthy journey to your everyday life. THAT will be the most challenging training of all... plinter reaches out and hands Leonardo an ANCIENT MEDALLION. Leo is touched. CLOSE ON SHADOWS OUTSIDE OF ROOM - We see a pair of EYES, watching the entire scene... jealous. I've missed you, Leonardo.

question: I've missed you too, father.
answer: I'm afraid much has changed in your brothers' spirits since you have left. But now that you are home, they will finally have the ethical and warrior leadership they have been lacking. The family needs you. ON LEO - He swallows that big pill very hard.

question: Heh. Yeah... I mean, yes sensei.
answer: Raphael, your brother is home.

question: Say, what's up with April and Casey? I expected them to drop by after I got back.
answer: We don't see much of `em anymore. April seems to be working a lot - eww - and Casey seems to be, I dunno, "different" lately. Maybe he doesn't like having to put the toilet seat down now that they've moved in together.

question: They're living together now? They get to the living room area. Mikey walks to the edge of a jury-rigged HALF-PIPE he built in an old water slough. Mikey continues as he skates back and forth.
answer: To be honest with ya, they're kinda buzzkills to be around.

question: Is Casey at least still doing his hockey mask thing?
answer: Dunno. Haven't noticed since The Nightwatcher has come home to roost. WOOOOHOOOOOOOO!

question: You know, the typical - corrupt government officials, double crossed by a jungle guide, all ending in a heart-pounding chase. Winters and April chuckle. Cam adjusts to show Casey between them in the bg, looking uncomfortable and out of place. But it was all worth it. beat - excited) I found it. The fourth General. Winters BEAMS, way too excited as well. April holds out her hand to Casey, who doesn't know what she wants. He awkwardly HIGH FIVES her.
answer: Yeah-ha! The fourth General.

question: The crow-bar.
answer: Oh. He hands it to April as she twirls up a CROW-BAR and cracks open the front panel. INSIDE BOX POV - The light gradually breaks in, until - CREAK - the front panel falls to the floor. CLOSE ON - Winters' look. Pure wonder and admiration. He walks up to it slowly. April and Casey cautiously stay back.

question: What!? It was a boring story!
answer: That is so perfectly CASEY JONES. I give you opportunity. I give you the chance to become a better man. And what do you do with it?

question: Well, maybe if you were home for more than four days at a time, you'd see that I DON'T WANT ANY OF
answer: Casey, you better be careful-

question: Here I am nice enough to help you out, dress in this get-up and all I get is grief?! ...as he knocks and SMASHES the vase to the floor. Oh boy. Klaxons sound as SHINK-SHINK-SHINK - METAL PLATES SLAM DOWN
answer: Give me strength.

question: You can come out now. IDER - As we see FOUR FIGURES appear out of the smallest and darkest of shadows! The LEADER slinks forward - clearly a Your talents are commendable.
answer: As are yours. Most don't notice us until we decide they will.

question: Well, I guess I'm just special that way. Winters walks over to his desk. The Statue looms behind them. So down to business - aside from the other reasons for your visit to America, are you interested in my offer we discussed?
answer: I must confess... I still don't know exactly what we are to do for you.

question: I need the finely-tuned eyes and stealth of your Foot Ninja to... monitor the city for me over the next few days. Winters walks to his window. It's night. Overlooks the city. Just keep your eyes peeled for anything... strange.
answer: What kind of strange things? The question hangs as we PUSH IN ON Statue's face... his eerie eyes. We think his eye GLOWS, only we-

question: -does the other team's chores for a week. Leo and Raph glare at each other.
answer: I'm with Leo!

question: Actually, I think you and I should pair up, Mikey.
answer: You kiddin' me?! I mean, no offense Donnie, but you ain't exactly the biggest hitter on the bench.

question: Have you been avoiding me? Barely seen you since I got home.
answer: I been busy. Why'd you think that?

question: I don't know... your brother gets to go on a world-wide training mission and you have to stay home. Might upset me too.
answer: Are you trying to make me mad?

question: I'm just saying, I'd understand if you were upset. Their intensity ESCALATES.
answer: You wouldn't understand the first thing about me, daddy's boy - OOF!. hey both trip over a duct, tumbling in a ball. They stop rolling, continue fighting.

question: Is that what this is about? You think Splinter likes me best?
answer: You'd love that, wouldn't you?

question: You see, now THAT'S a good soldier. You two should compare notes. Karai and Aguila stare at each other. Karai obviously not used to being handled like this.
answer: Just what is this all about?

question: Oh, let's call it a scavenger hunt. I now have the power and know-how, but I need the speed and stealth of an organization such as your own. Not to mention an organization that values discretion.
answer: But of course.

question: You sure you don't want to spar a bit?
answer: Nah. Ever since you started with the blade weapons you, um... you kinda scare me.

question: Suit yourself. Case?
answer: Yeah? Yeah. Sure. You? April thinks just as much.

question: Yeah. They sit on that for a moment. Casey leans in for a kiss. April doesn't notice. Awkward. Casey changes his mind.
answer: I'm going outside for some air.

question: I kinda liked "The Midnight Marauder"...
answer: Stick with Nightwatcher, ninja boy.

question: Pfft. You kiddin' me? Leo's been away for, like, forever. And the other two are so wrapped up in that party business they'd never notice.
answer: They're good... I guess. I dunno, seems like all I do lately is just make her upset. She used to laugh so much... now it's mostly just working all day, and coming home to point out how I'm a screw up. She doesn't like me doing this. And I know she's pretending to not know I'm out tonight. But she knows. And she knows I know she knows. Life just kinda got complicated suddenly... y'know?

question: Yer tellin' me... Casey looks at his old bud.
answer: Raph?

question: Yeah?
answer: Nice to see ya, man. Raph acknowledges. The moment is broken by a HORRIBLE SHRIEK!

question: For old time's sake?
answer: What the shell. ON RAPH - He stops, mid-replacement of his helmet. I think we lost it.

question: It's gotta be around here somewhere. SCREEEEECH!!! - A large VAMPIRE-LIKE CREATURE flies up from the alley below and spreads its 30-foot wings!
answer: WHAT'S GOIN' ON, RAPH?!

question: Did I mention we ran into a monster last week?
answer: NO. NO, YOU KINDA FAILED TO TELL ME The freakin' FOOT?! What about the walking statues? Were you going to mention THOSE?!

question: Nope. Those are a first for me too. We can take `em. One of the generals effortlessly picks up a TRASH DUMPSTER and wallops the Creature with one blow.
answer: On second thought... The Generals put the Creature in a cell. Wheel it to a TRANSPORTER VEHICLE as it drives away. They're just about to leave when-

question: Hey - you're the ninja, not me! BOOM! - Gato lands up on the roof and quickly gives chase! They can't lose him, even when they drop to street level. WHAT WERE THOSE THINGS, RAPH?! Raph ignores him, looking for a street sign. Then he sees it - 56th Street.
answer: Bingo. Raphael quickly dashes left through TRAFFIC! DOWN ALLEY BEHIND THEM - BOOM BOOM BOOM - We see Gato bounding down the wall, almost in a four-legged run, occasionally jumping off walls at incredible speeds! A true jaguar. It leaps through the traffic as well.

question: What are we gonna do, Raph? WHAT
answer: Hop on. Raph leaves Gato in a cloud of dust... but not for long. Gato clamors along... keeping up with the weaving bike! In the fray, Casey looses his mask... as it gets trampled by Gato. It's an insane chase, with Raph trying to lose him as Casey swings his bat, trying to stave off the Stone General. Suddenly - THUNK! A circular OBSIDIAN BLADE lands in his wooden bat. He looks at it.

question: Raphael? What is the matter? Raphael! Kneel. Raph stops. Breathing heavy. Falls in line - walking to Splinter and dropping to his knees in front of his father.
answer: I did something... I did something really stupid, Master Splinter.

question: Go on... Raphael. You always bear the world's problems on your shoulders. It is an admirable quality when you are a protector of others... plinter gently lays a hand on Raph's shoulder. But you must realize that while, at times, you may not be my favorite student, it does not mean that you are my least favorite son. Raphael looks up. Having not thought of it that way. You are strong, passionate and loyal to a fault. These are the merits of a great leader as well... but only when tempered with compassion and humility.
answer: But Master Splinter, I messed up big tonight... I mean BIG. Splinter chews on this.

question: So, the first time that this portal was opened, the Stars of Kikin aligned... (sketches on high tech
answer: Precisely at 40.748 degrees latitude and -073.985 Degrees longitude. ON OTHERS - HUH?! Mikey air - calculates math in bg.

question: New York City.
answer: Winters Tower.

question: Wow.
answer: Picked it up on my last trip to Japan. You... like it?

question: Oh... oh yeah. They share the moment. Seeing what they forgot about each other when they first met. It's enough for them to smile.
answer: Where's your mask?

question: Mask? What mask? April runs into the other room and comes back with her hands behind her back. She takes out a NEW MASK for Casey - cool, crisp and a badass paintjob. No way...
answer: I was saving it for our anniversary. That's our ride.
